intro: Arabis boissieuana var. nikoensis, commonly known as the Nikoensis rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are basal, lobed, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens or alpine settings.
